answers.answer: Girl I'm on the same exact boat I'm 27 +5 and gained 40 pounds they have been on my case since the beginning I stress but I know I will breastfeed and work out so I'm not even going to stress myself out although they didn't tell me nothing about preeclampsia

I plan on doing the same I wanna breastfeed for at least 3 to 4 months an work out everyday to lose the weight but im just scared ill get preeclampsia my mom had that her last four pregnancy an its not pretty at all ima try not to work myself up abf it until after my dr talk to me in two wks I know this time Im gonna have a list of questions to ask her lol im a ftm so im really nervous :(

I gained 70 pounds with my son, and lost it all plus some. Got down to a size 4. Of course I got pregnant again and have already gained 55 pounds at week 33. The only down side I've noticed with that much weight gain was that my son was 9 pounds when he was born (lots of stitches) but very healthy so that was good, and you probably will get stretch marks if you don't have them already. A lot of it could just be excess fluid. I lost 40 pounds by the time I left the hospital.

I feel your pain, but im just getting started( nine weeks preggo). Im a bit overweight and they said all i need to gain is ten pounds like how is that even possible ?! I wouldnt worry too much about the weight as long as the baby is healthy you can deal with losing it afterwards

The amount you plan to lose after baby doesn't matter. They worry because excessive weight gain puts you at risk for gestational diabetes, high blood pressure, and preeclampsia,  as well as greatly increases the likelihood that you'll need a csection and increases your risk for post-op infection and complications.
I'm going through the same thing. I was overweight before being pregnant and my doctor is acting like my baby isn't even supposed to gain weight at all. I go walking now and I'm on a diet.
I dnt have stretch marks yet but I know they'll be coming soon an thats what im scared of she gonna come out 8+ pounds an I won't be able to push her out

Right thats what I be saying when dr tell me to slow down my eating everyone always tell me im small to be seven months im carrying her all over tho I just wanna make sure she comes out a good size an for some reason im never full
Yea I know she explained all that to me at the last visit Im trying to avoid all of those
I go for walks here an there an I try to eat as healthy as I can its just hard especially when your little one is kicking the crap outta yu cause she's hungry lol
That worries  me now because I was put on a diet and my lil girl has been kicking me more I hope I'm not starving her.

Babies take what they need from you, you won't starve your baby and kicking doesn't mean they are hungry. There have been women in poverty and times of famine that barely ate anything and had babies born at a healthy weight.

Your not the only one girl since I got oregnant I weight 150 now im almodt 200 pounds I wasnt like that I was a size 3 but since I didnt wait to get pregnant thay was my miscariage weight so now im all stressing becuasw I love how my body was before now when I have baby I have to work really hard to get to how I was before good luck mamas its hard but thats what it is having a baby
I was a 6/7 now im an 12/13 but I know ill get my body back with a lil hard work and dedication

question: So my doctor been getting on me abt my weight gain I've tried cutting back but clearly it hasn't helped my pre-pregnancy weight was 139lb ((&)) today I went for a physical an I gained 9lbs in one week all together this pregnancy I've gained 40.6lb an im only 28wks he told me my ob is gonna talk to me again on the 10/2  they said it could be a sign of early preeclampsia an if I get it I'll get induced at 37wks have anyone else had this problem((?))
title: ugh idk what to do plz read
